cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 55 mi (90 km) W of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking north-northwest today, turning north tonight and north-northeast on Wednesday, moving parallel to/along the west coast of Florida and then across the southeastern U.S.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north Florida Gulf coast (near the Big Bend region)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm-surge and tropical-storm watches are confined to the U.S. Gulf and Southeast Atlantic coasts – none in Puerto Rico.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Warnings extend from the Florida Keys northward along Florida’s west coast; none issued for Puerto Rico.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf coast, Georgia, South Carolina, and the U.S. East Coast northward to New England.
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None (San Juan not listed in current wind-probability table)
weather_observation.first_hazard: None (storm has already passed the port)
